style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) may invest any moneys belonging to the University, including any unapplied income, in any of the securities described in section 20 of the Trusts Act, 1882, or in the purchase of immovable property in Bangladesh with the like power of varying such investments, or may place on fixed deposits in any approved Bank any portion of such moneys not required for immediate expenditure;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) shall administer any funds placed at the disposal of the University for specific purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) shall consider and pass the budget of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) shall admit colleges to the privileges of the University, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and under such conditions as may be prescribed by the Statutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) shall arrange for and direct the inspection of colleges and Teaching Departments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) may institute such teaching or administrative posts as it may consider necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) may abolish or suspend any existing teaching or administrative post in the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) shall, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance and the Statutes, appoint the officers on the recommendation of the Vice Chancellor, and teachers on the recommendation of the Selection Board, and shall determine their duties and conditions of appointment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) may confer and grant degrees and diplomas;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) shall, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, regulate, determine and administer all matters concerning the University, and, to this end, shall exercise all other powers not otherwise provided for by this Ordinance, or the Statutes and the University Ordinances; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) may delegate any of its powers to an officer or an Authority of the University or to a committee or sub committee appointed for a specific purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Academic Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Academic Council shall consist of the following:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the Vice Chancellor (Chairman);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (ia) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, all the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) the Deans of the Faculties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (iia) the Director of Graduate Training Institute;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) the Heads of the University Teaching Departments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (iv) the University Professors and Associate Professors;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) five persons to be nominated by the Chancellor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Academic Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Academic Council shall have the power¬-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to advise the Syndicate on all academic matters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to make University Ordinances for the proper conduct of teaching, research and examination, and for promoting academic life in the University and the colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to lay down conditions under which students may be given admission to the various courses of study and the examinations held by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to propose to the Syndicate schemes for the constitution of University Departments and Boards of Studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to deal with University teaching and to make proposals for the planning and development of teaching and research in the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to prescribe, subject to the approval of the Syndicate and upon the recommendations of the Boards of Studies and Faculties, the courses of studies, the syllabuses and the outlines of texts for all the examinations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the recommendations of a Board of Studies or Faculty are not available to the Academic Council by the 10th of April each year, it may, subject to the approval of the Syndicate, continue, for the next year, the courses of studies already prescribed for an examination;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to recognise the examinations of other Universities or Boards as equivalent to the corresponding examinations of the University; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to make University Ordinance, for the award of Fellowships, Scholarships, medals and prizes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Term of office of members of the Syndicate and the Academic Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The term of office of the nominated members and the quorum for the meeting of the Syndicate and of the Academic Council shall be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution, powers and duties of the authorities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the constitution, powers and duties of the Faculties, Boards of Studies, Selection Boards, Committee for Advanced Studies and Research, Finance Committee, Planning and Development Committee and other Authorities shall be such as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Statutes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Statutes may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the constitution, powers and duties of the Autho¬rities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the constitution of pension and provident funds for the benefit of the officers, teachers and other employees of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the designations, powers and duties of the officers and teachers of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the conditions of service of the officers, teachers and other employees of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the mode of appointment of the officers and tea¬chers of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the duration of courses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the medium of instruction and examinations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the fees to be charged for courses of study in the University and for admission to the examina¬tions held by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the creation and abolition of posts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the establishment of Teaching Departments and constituent colleges; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) all other matters which, by this Ordinance, are to be, or may be, prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Framing of Statutes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance, the Statutes set out in the Schedule shall be the Statutes of the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Statutes may be amended, repealed or added to by Statutes made by the Syndicate in the manner hereinafter appearing.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Syndicate may propose to the Chancellor the draft of any Statute to be assented to by him:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no Statute relating to any matter mentioned in clauses (f), (g), (h), (i) and (j) of section 22 shall be proposed unless it has first been referred to the Academic Council and the Academic Council has expressed its opinion on it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Statute proposed by the Syndicate shall have no validity until it has been assented to by the Chancellor. The Chancellor may assent to a Statute as proposed by the Syndicate or withhold his assent, or may refer it back to the Syndicate for re consideration; and the Statute shall be re submitted to the Chancellor for his assent thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">University Ordinances</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. The Academic Council may, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and the Statutes, frame University Ordinances providing for all or any of the following matters-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) registration of the students in the University, and admission of the students in the University and constituent and affiliated colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) equivalence of examinations conducted by other Universities and institutions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) framing of detailed syllabuses for the examinations held by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) conditions of admission to the examinations held by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) conduct of examinations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) condition of residence of the students;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) condition of admission to the Teaching Departments and constituent and affiliated colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (gg) conduct and discipline of the students of the University, and punishment including rustication and expulsion for misconduct and breach of discipline;] and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) all other matters which, by this Ordinance, are to be or may be prescribed by the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Approval of University Ordinances by Syndicate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) When a University Ordinance has been framed under section 24, it shall be submitted to the Syndicate which may approve or reject it or may refer it back to the Academic Council for re consideration and re submission to the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A University Ordinance framed by the Academic Council shall have no validity until it has received the approval of the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) The Authorities of the University may make regulations consistent with this Ordinance, the Statutes and the University Ordinances-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) laying down the procedure to be followed at their meetings; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) providing for all matters solely concerning such Authorities and not provided for by this Ordinance, the Statutes and the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Authority of the University shall make regulations providing for the giving of notice to the members of such Authority, of the dates of meetings, and of the business to be transacted at the meetings, and for keep¬ing of records of the proceedings of the meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Syndicate may direct the amendment, in such a manner as it may specify, of any regulation made under sub section (1) or sub section (2) or the annulment of any regulation made under sub section (1):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any Authority which is dissatisfied with any such direction may appeal to the Chancellor whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">University Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The University shall have a fund to be called the University Fund and to which shall be credited¬-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) its income from fees, donations, trusts, bequests, endowments, grants and all other sources;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any contribution or grant by the 12[ Government].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, contribute annually to the University such sum of money as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit of Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The statement of the accounts of the University shall, once a year, be submitted to the Government for the purpose of annual audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Interpretation in case of doubt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. If any question arises regarding the interpretation of any provision of this Ordinance or of any Statutes, University Ordinance or regulation or as to whether any person has been duly nominated as, or is entitled to be, a member of any authority or other body of the University, the matter shall be reported to the Chancellor, whose decision thereon shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Filling of casual vacancies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. All casual vacancies among the members (other than the ex officio members) of any Authority or other body of the University shall be filled, as soon as may be, by the person or Authority or body which appointed, or nominated the member whose place has become vacant, and the person appointed, or nominated to a casual vacancy shall be a member of such Authority or body for the residue of the term for which the person whose place he fills would have been a member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Proceedings not invalidated by vacancy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. No act or proceeding of any Authority or other body of the University shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of such Authority or body.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Pension and Provident Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. The University shall constitute for the benefit of the officers, teachers and other employees, such pension and provident funds, in such manner and subject to such conditions, as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Protection of Acts and Orders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. No order made under this Ordinance, or under any Statute, University Ordinance or Regulation made there¬under, shall be called in question in any Court; and no suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance or any Statute, University Ordinance or Regulation made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members of Authorities and employees to be public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. The members of the Authorities, the employees of the University and other persons appointed for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance, shall be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the 13[ * * *] Penal Code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition to seek elections, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. The employees of the University shall neither seek nor contest election to any Legislature or local body.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of First Registrar</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Statutes, the first Registrar may be appointed by the Chancellor for a period not exceeding one year on such terms and conditions as the Chancellor may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal by the Chancellor of difficulties at the commencement of the Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. The Chancellor may, for the purpose of removing any difficulties in first giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance, particularly in relation to the first constitution of any Authority of the University, by an order in writing, direct that such action be taken as he may deem necessary or expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted for the words “East Pakistan” or “Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” or “Central Government” respectively by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “East Pakistan” was omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “The President of the People's Republic of Bangladesh” were substituted for the words “The Governor of East Pakitsan” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (iia) was inserted by section 2 of the Agricultural  University (Amendment) Act, 1999 (Act No. XIII of 1999)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Section 13A was inserted by section 3 of the Agricultural  University (Amendment) Act, 1999 (Act No. XIII of 1999)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Clause (ia) was inserted by section 4 of the Agricultural  University (Amendment) Act, 1999 (Act No. XIII of 1999)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Clauses (ii) and (iii) were substituted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Clause (ia) was inserted by section 4 of the Agricultural  University (Amendment) Act, 1999 (Act No. XIII of 1999)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clause (iia) was inserted by section 2 of the Agrucultural  University (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Clause (iv) was substituted by section 2 of the Agrucultural  University (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Clause (gg) was inserted by section 4 of the East   Pakistan Agricultural University (Amendment) Ordinance, 1962 (East Pakistan Ordinance No. XXV of 1962)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The word “Government” was substituted for the words “Central or the Provincial Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The word “Pakistan” was omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
300	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE AIRCRAFT (REMOVAL OF DANGER TO SAFETY) ORDINANCE, 1965 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE AIRCRAFT (REMOVAL OF DANGER TO SAFETY) ORDINANCE, 1965 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XII OF 1965).[16th July, 1965]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for the removal of danger to the safety of aircraft.         1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the removal of danger to the safety of aircraft caused by the location of bird attracting sites around certain airfields;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the National Assembly is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate legislation necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 29 of the Constitution, and of all other powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Aircraft (Removal of Danger to Safety) Ordinance, 1965.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of 2[ Bangladesh].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (a)    “airfield” means the Zia International Airport, Dhaka, Civil Airport Chittagong, Sylhet Osmani Airport, Civil Airport Cox's Bazar, Civil Airport Saidpur, Civil Airport Rajshahi, Civil Airport Jessore, Civil Airport Ishurdi, the Bangladesh Air Force airfield at Dhaka and such other aerodrome as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be an airfield within the meaning of this Ordinance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “specified area” means the area lying within a radius of five nautical miles from either end of a runway of an airfield.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Measures to avoid attraction of birds</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may by order require the owner or the person in possession or having the management or control of any tannery, slaughter-house, cattle-yard, fish-drying area, refuse-dump or other place within a specified area which attracts birds to take within such period as may be specified in the order such measures for avoiding attraction of birds which may endanger the safety of aircraft as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person affected by an order under sub-section (1) may, within thirty days following the order, make an application to the Government for a review of the order on the ground that the measures directed to be taken are not necessary or that alternative measures described in the application would be equally effective for avoiding attraction of birds.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, after considering the application made under sub-section (2) and giving the applicant an opportunity of being heard, modify, cancel or confirm the order made under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Non-compliance with order under section 3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Where an order made under sub-section (1) of section 3 is not complied with the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, prohibit the use of, or the carrying on of any trade or occupation in the tannery, slaughter-house, cattle-yard, fish-drying area, refuse-dump or other place with respect to which the order was made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on construction or extension of tannery, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Within a specified area, no tannery, slaughter-house or cattle-yard shall be constructed, established or extended and no place shall be used for fish-drying or as a refuse-dump or for carrying on any trade or occupation which attracts birds except with the prior permission in writing of the Government and in accordance with the terms and conditions, if any, on which the permission is granted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of entry in premises, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Any person authorised in this behalf by the Government may at any time between sunrise and sunset enter and inspect any tannery, slaughter-house, cattle-yard or fish-drying area or any premises or land used as a refuse-dump or for carrying on any trade or occupation which may attract birds, for the purpose of ascertaining the extent of danger to the safety of aircraft caused by the attraction of birds and seeing whether the provisions of this Ordinance and any order or notification made or issued thereunder have been complied with.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Whoever fails to comply with or contravenes any of the provisions of this Ordinance or any order, direction or notification issued or made thereunder, or wilfully obstructs any person in doing any of the acts authorised by this Ordinance shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to 4[ three years], or with fine which may extend to 5[ five thousand Taka], or with both, and in the case of a continuing offence, with an additional fine which may extend to 6[ fifty Taka] for every day after the first during which the offence continues.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to try an offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. No Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the first class shall try an offence punishable under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) No order made, notification issued or proceeding taken under this Ordinance shall be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Government” was substituted for the words “Central Government” by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the word “Pakistan” by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (a) was substituted by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “three years” were substituted for the words “six months” by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “five thousand Taka” were substituted for the words “five hundred rupees” by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 e words “fifty Taka” were substituted for the words “twenty rupees” by section 3 of the Civil Aviation Laws Amendment Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
301	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ALLOPATHIC SYSTEM (PREVENTION OF MISUSE) ORDINANCE (ORDINANCE NO. LXV OF 1962). </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ALLOPATHIC SYSTEM (PREVENTION OF MISUSE) ORDINANCE (ORDINANCE NO. LXV OF 1962). </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[7th June, 1962]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to prevent the misuse of the allopathic system of medicine and to provide for matters connected therewith.             1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to prevent the misuse of the allopathic system of medicine and to provide for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Allopathic System (Prevention of Misuse) Ordinance, 1962.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definition </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “registered medical practitioner” means a person registered under the 2[ Medical and Dental Council Act, 1980 (XVI of 1980)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of the use of the word “doctor” and its variations, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. No person practising the allopathic, homoeopathic, ayurvedic, unani or any other system of medicine shall use with his name or address or with the name or address of his business the word “doctor” or any of its grammatical variations, cognate expressions or abbreviations so as to give out that he is entitled to practise medicine unless he is a registered medical practitioner:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this section shall apply to a person on whom a Doctor's degree other than medical degree has been conferred by any university in or outside Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of the use of medical degrees or diplomas</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. No person shall use a medical degree or a medical diploma to give out that he is a qualified medical practitioner or for any purpose connected with medical practice, unless such degree or diploma has been conferred or awarded by a university or institution in or outside Bangladesh recognised under the 3[ Medical and Dental Council Act, 1980 (XVI of 1980)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of performing surgical operations by unqualified persons</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No person other than a registered medical practitioner shall perform any surgical operation other than circumcision, incision of boils and administration of injections.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition for prescribing certain drugs</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. No person other than a registered medical practitioner or a person authorised in this behalf by the Government shall prescribe any antibiotic or dangerous drug specified in the rules made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on the sale of patent and proprietory medicines</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. No person shall sell in the market any patent or proprietory medicine of the unani, ayurvedic, homoeopathic or biochemic system of medicine unless there is displayed, in a conspicuous and readily intelligible manner, on the label or container thereof and also on the outer cover of the container (other than ordinary wrapper) the true formula of the medicine contained in it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Rule-making powers of the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The 4[ Government] may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Whoever contravenes the provisions of section 3 or section 4 or section 5 or section 6 or section 7 shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to one year or with fine not exceeding two thousand 5[ taka], or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) No prosecution shall be instituted under this Ordinance except by an Inspector appointed under the Drugs Act, 1940, or by a person specially empowered by the Government in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the first class shall try an offence punishable under this Ordinance and notwithstanding anything contained in section 32 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, it shall be lawful for such Magistrate to pass any sentence of fine to the extent provided for by this Ordinance in excess of his powers under the said section 32.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Protection</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No suit or proceeding shall lie against any Inspector or person acting in good faith under section 10 of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted for the words “Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” respectively by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words, comma, figures and brackets “Medical and Dental Council Act, 1980 (XVI of 1980)” were substituted for the words, comma, figures and brackets “Medical Council's Ordinance, 1962 (XXXII of 1962)” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words, comma, figures and brackets “Medical and Dental Council Act, 1980 (XVI of 1980)” were substituted for the words, comma, figures and brackets “Medical Council's Ordinance, 1962 (XXXII of 1962)” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Government” was substituted for the words “Central Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “taka” was substituted for the word “rupees” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
302	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE CADET COLLEGE ORDINANCE, 1964 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE CADET COLLEGE ORDINANCE, 1964 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE NO. II OF 1964).[30th June, 1964]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for establishment of Cadet Colleges in Bangladesh. 1 2</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for establishment of Cadet Colleges in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the Provincial Assembly of East Pakistan is not in session and the Governor is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate legislation necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by Article 79 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan and all other powers enabling him in that behalf, the Governor is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the 3[ * * *] Cadet College Ordinance, 1964.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Cadet” means a student of the College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “College” means a Cadet  College established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (bb) “Council of Cadet Colleges” means the Council of Cadet Colleges constituted under section 4A;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Governing Body” means the Governing Body of Cadet College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Regulation” means regulation made by the Governing Body under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Rules” means the rules made by the Council of Cadet Colleges.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of Cadet Colleges</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, if it thinks fit, may, by notification in the official Gazette, establish one or more Cadet College or Colleges in such area or areas on such date or dates as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every College shall be a body corporate by the name of the Cadet College and shall have perpetual succession and a common seal, and shall, by the said name, sue and be sued, with power to acquire and hold property, both movable and immovable, and, subject to prescribed conditions, to transfer any property held by it, and to contract and do all other things necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The headquarter of the College shall be located at such place as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and functions of the College</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The College shall exercise the following powers and perform the following duties, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to provide a sound liberal public school education;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to provide elementary military training to Cadets;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to provide for instruction in such branches of learning as the College may think fit; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to do all such other acts and things, whether incidental to the powers aforesaid or not, as may be requisite in order to further the objects of the College as a teaching institution and to cultivate and promote arts, science and other branches of learning.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Council of Cadet Colleges</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 6[ 4A. The Council of Cadet Colleges shall consist of the following, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Secretary, Ministry of Defence, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Chairman, Governing Body, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Additional Secretary, Ministry of Finance, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Joint Secretary, Ministry of Education (Education Division), ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (e)    Director, Army Education, Bangladesh Army, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         One person to be nominated by the Chief of Naval Staff, Bangladesh Navy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        One person to be nominated by the Chief of Air Staff, Bangladesh Air Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        Director of Public Instruction, ex- officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Principle, Faujdarhat   Cadet College, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         Principal, Jhenidah   Cadet College, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) Principal, Momenshahi Cadet  College, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) Principal, Rajshahi Cadet  College, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Member-Secretary</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) Joint Secretary, Ministry of Defence, ex-officio.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Council of Cadet Colleges</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4B. (1) The Council of Cadet Colleges shall ordinarily meet twice a year at Dacca on a date to be fixed by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman may, whenever he thinks fit, convene a special meeting of the Council of Cadet Colleges.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Council of Cadet Colleges</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4C. (1) The Council of Cadet Colleges shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) prescribe, subject to availability of funds, the scales of pay of the teaching and administrative staff;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        determine the duties and conditions of service of the employees of the Cadet Colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        prescribe, subject to prior approval of the Boards of Intermediate and Secondary Education, the courses of study for all classes of the Cadet Colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        consider and approve the annual accounts, balance sheet and annual budget estimate of the Cadet Colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        determine the award of scholarships to cadets;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         regulate admission of cadets to the Cadet Colleges; 8[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        dealt with any other matter common to all Cadet Colleges 9[ ; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (h) appoint the Principal and the Vice-Principal of the Colleges.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Council of Cadet Colleges may make rules for the proper discharge of its functions specified in sub-section (1) of this section.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Governing Body</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ 5. The Governing Body shall consist of the following, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ (a)  Adjutant   General, Bangladesh Army (ex-officio);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        One representative of the Commissioner of the Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        Deputy Director of Public Instruction of the Division (ex-officio);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Local Brigade Commander (ex-officio);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Member-Secretary</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) Principal of the College (ex-officio).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Governing Body</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Governing Body shall be the Executive Body of the College and subject to other provisions of the Ordinance and the powers conferred on the Council of Cadet Colleges, shall have the general management and superintendence over the affairs, concerns and property of the College. The assets of the College shall vest in the Governing Body.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to other provisions contained in this Ordinance, the Governing Body,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) shall hold, control and administer the property and funds of the College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) shall determine the form, provide for the custody and regulate the use, of the common seal of the College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        shall submit to the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh annually a full statement of the financial requirements of the College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        shall administer any funds placed at the disposal of the College for specific purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) shall have power to accept on behalf of the College transfers any movable or immovable property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (f)  subject to the provisions of this Ordinance shall except the Principal and the Vice-Principal, appoint the members of the staff and shall provide for the filling of temporary vacancies in their posts;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        shall consider, examine and initiate proposals for the improvement of the College;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) shall consider and pass such resolutions on the annual report, the annual accounts and the financial estimates as it thinks fit; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) shall exercise such other powers and functions and such other duties as may be conferred or imposed on it by this Ordinance or the regulation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to supersede the Governing Body</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The 15[ Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh] may, by an order in the official Gazette, supersede the Governing Body when he considers that it has failed to discharge its duties properly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual report</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The annual report of the College shall be prepared under the direction of the Governing Body, and shall be submitted to the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh within three months of the close of the academic year to which such report relates.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh may make suggestions on the annual report and communicate the same to the Governing Body which shall take such actions as it thinks fit, and the Governing Body shall inform the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh of the action taken by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual Account</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The annual accounts and balance sheets of the College shall be prepared under the direction of the Governing Body and shall be submitted to the Council of Cadet Colleges for consideration and approval.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the College shall be audited by the Accountant-General, Bangladesh and the audit report together with the Governing Body's comments thereon shall be submitted to the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh for approval.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The annual budget estimate shall be prepared by the Governing Body which shall submit the same to the Council of Cadet Colleges for consideration and approval.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh shall contribute annually to the Cadet Colleges such sum of money as may be determined by them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Governing Body of the College may make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance, for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Proceeding of the College authorities not invalidated by vacancies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No act or proceeding of the Governing Body of the College shall be invalidated merely by reason of the existence of a vacancy or vacancies among its members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to remove difficulties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. If any difficulty arises with respect to the establishment of the College or Governing Body of the College or otherwise in first giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance, 16[ Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh] may, by order, make any appointment or do anything which appears to him necessary or expedient and every such order shall have effect as if such appointment or action had been made or taken in the manner provided in this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. [Repeal and saving.- Repealed by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the East Pakistan Repealing and Amending Ordinance, 1966 (East Pakistan Ordinance No. XIII of 1966).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance the word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the words “East Pakistan” by Article 5 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Throughout this Ordinance the words “Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh” were substituted for the words “Provincial Government” by Article 2 of the Cadet College Ordinance (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 89 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “East Pakistan” were omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 3 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1970 (East Pakistan Ordinance No. II of 1970)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Sections 4A, 4B and 4C were inserted by section 4 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1970 (East Pakistan Ordinance No. II of 1970)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Section 4A was substituted by section 2 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. X of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Clause (e) was substituted by section 2 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1978</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The word “and” was omitted by Article 4 of the Cadet College Ordinance (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 89 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The semi-colon and the word “; and” were substituted for the full stop (.) by Article 4 of the Cadet College Ordinance (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 89 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Clause (h) was inserted by Article 4 of the Cadet College Ordinance (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 89 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Section 5 was substituted by section 3 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Act, 1973 (Act No. XX of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 Clause (a) was substituted by section 2 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1979 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1979)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Clause (f) was substituted by Article 6 of the Cadet College Ordinance (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 89 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 Clause (h) was omitted by section 6 of the Cadet  College (Amendment) Ordinance, 1970 (East Pakistan Ordinance No. II of 1970)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 The words “Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh” were substituted for the words “Governor of East Pakistan” by Article 9 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The words “Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh” were substituted for the words “the Governor” by Article 9 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
303	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE CANTONMENTS RENT RESTRICTION ACT, 1963 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE CANTONMENTS RENT RESTRICTION ACT, 1963 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XI OF 1963).[27th April, 1963]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An  Act to make provision for the control of rents of certain class of buildings within the limits of the Cantonment areas and for the eviction of tenants therefrom.       1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the control of rents of certain class of buildings within the limits of the cantonment areas, for the eviction of tenants therefrom and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Cantonments Rent Restriction Act, 1963.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to all the cantonments in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “building” means any building or part of a building, whether residential or not, together with all fittings and fixtures therein, if any, and includes any gardens, grounds, garages and outhouses attached or appurtenant to such building or part, and vacant land, but does not include any place of religious worship;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Cantonment Board” means a Cantonment Board constituted under the Cantonments Act, 1924;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “commercial building” means a building used solely for the purposes of business or trade;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Controller” means a Controller of Rents appointed by the Government under sub-section (1) of section 6 and includes an Additional Controller of Rents appointed under sub-section (2) of that section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “family” of a person means and includes a husband, wife, children, dependent parents, dependent brothers, unmarried or widowed sisters and a deceased son's widow and children residing with, and wholly dependent upon, that person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “a house” is said to be in a state of reasonable repair, when-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         all floors, walls, pillars, arches and roofs are sound and watertight,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        all doors and windows are intact, properly painted or oiled, and provided with proper hooks or bolts or other necessary fastenings,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       all rooms, outhouses and appurtenant buildings are properly colour-washed or white-washed, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       all electric, water and sanitary fittings, if any, are properly maintained and are safe, sound and without leakage;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Landlord” means any person for the time being entitled to receive rent in respect of any building whether on his own account or on behalf or for the benefit of any other person, or as a trustee, guardian or receiver
