317	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE JUTE ORDINANCE, 1962 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE JUTE ORDINANCE, 1962 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXIV OF 1962).[10th September, 1962]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to consolidate and amend the law relating to trade in Jute and jute manufactures.   1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to trade in jute 2[ and jute manufactures] in order to provide for measures for the regulation and promotion of internal and international trade therein, for the licensing of 3[ traders in jute, jute manufacturers and owners of] kutcha and pucca jute presses, for the collection of statistics in respect of the Jute trade and industry, and for the levying of a cess on jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the national interest of Bangladesh in relation to the economic and financial stability of Bangladesh so requires;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the National Assembly is not in session and the Speaker, acting as President under Article 16 of the Constitution, is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate legislation necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of Article 16 of the Constitution and in exercise of the powers conferred by Article 29 of the Constitution read with clause (2) of Article 131 thereof and of all other powers enabling him in that behalf, the Speaker, acting as President, makes and promulgates the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title, extent and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Jute Ordinance, 1962.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “contract” means a contract for the sale of jute or jute manufactures to any person in or outside Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (c)    “trader” means any person who purchases, or negotiates for the purchase of, or sells, or undertakes the grading or baling or spinning, or manufacturing of, jute or jute manufactures but does not include a grower of jute selling his own produce;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “exporter” means a shipper or a person who exports jute or jute manufactures from Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “grower of jute” means any person who, either by himself or by members of his family or by hired labourers or by adhiars or borgadars grows jute in any year on any land in his possession;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “jute” means the fibre of jute plant known botanically as belonging to the genus corchorus, including all the species of that genus, whether known as pat, kosta, nalia or by any other name, and also means the fibre of the plant known botanically as hibiscus cannabinus and commonly called mesta, and includes any jute fibre which has not been subjected to any process of spinning or weaving, and jute cuttings, whether loose or packed in drums or bales;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “jute manufacture” means hessian, gunnies, twine, yarn, matting and any other article manufactured wholly or mainly from jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “jute mill” means a machine by which jute goods of any description such as twine, sacking, hessian, ropes, gunny cloth and the like can be manufactured;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         “kutcha press” means a pressing machine, driven by manual labour or by power, 7[ or any other device] by which jute is packed in bales known as “kutcha bales” generally weighing up to 8[ One hundred and fifty kilograms]each and generally meant for consumption within Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “licensing” means the grant or renewal of a licence under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         “notified order” means an order published in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (o) “Owner of a press” means the person who owns a jute press, and including a managing agent to whom the affairs of a jute press are entrusted, but does not include a person to whom a jute press has been leased on rental basis;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q)        “pucca press” means a pressing machine, driven by power by which jute is packed in bales generally 11[ weighing 182.25 kilograms including 2.25 kilograms binding ropes of same quality jute]each and meant for export, and includes a pressing machine known as semi-pucca press.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. [Constitution of the Board.- Omitted by section 4 of the Jute (Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XLIX of 1974).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers of Government relating to jute trade</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ 4. The Government may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        lay down and execute the policy relating to internal and international trade in jute and jute manufactures;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        supervise and regulate dealings in jute and jute manufactures;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        assist in making arrangements for the transport and shipment of jute and jute manufactures within the country and to foreign countries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) issue licences to 13[ traders and owners of kutcha and pucca presses] and renew and, if necessary, suspend or cancel, such licences;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) collect and publish statistics relating to the production and export of jute and jute manufactures;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) undertake such business or acquire, take over or manage the business of such concern as it may direct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         quality standards and the grading of jute and jute manufactures,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) measures for any programme of price stabilisation, buffer stock operations or State trading, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       the settlement of claims of, or against, the Government arising out of any price stabilisation or support scheme, buffer stock operations or scheme of State trading in jute.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. [Control of the Board.- Omitted by section 6 of the Jute (Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XLIX of 1974).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Licensing</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) No person shall, after the commencement of this Ordinance, carry on 14[ business in jute and jute manufactures] in any manner or form, unless he is licensed under this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that it shall not be necessary for any grower of jute to obtain any licence for selling jute grown by him:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All 16[ traders and owners of] kutcha or pucca presses shall be licensed within such period and by such authority as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Licences granted under this Ordinance may be for such type of business or for such area as may be specified therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Licences granted under this Ordinance may be on such conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Licences granted under this Ordinance shall be personal and non-transferable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Licences granted under this Ordinance shall be valid up to the end of the financial year to which they relate and be renewed annually within such period as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) There shall be paid to the Government a prescribed fee for every licence or renewal thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) A licence granted or renewed under this section may be suspended or cancelled by the prescribed authority,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for any contravention of any of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for breach of the conditions subject to which the licence was granted, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        if the holder of the licence has ceased to carry on the business or has sold or otherwise transferred his interest in the business in respect of which the licence was granted, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        for contravening or failing to comply with any law relating to internal trade, export or foreign exchange control, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        for obtaining or attempting to obtain any such licence by fraud, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         for non-payment of any prescribed fees, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        for committing any practice relating to trade, commerce and industry which, in the opinion of the Government, is detrimental to the public interest, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        for committing breach of any order made under this Ordinance regarding quality, standard, prices, charges or commissions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) The holder of a licence shall not be entitled to any compensation for any loss or damage suffered by him as a result of the suspension or cancellation of his licence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order under section 6 may appeal to the prescribed authority within thirty days from the date of issue of such order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An appeal under sub-section (1) shall be presented in such manner and shall be accompanied by such fee as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fixation of prices</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Government may, by notified order, fix minimum prices below which, and maximum prices above which, jute or jute manufactures of various grades shall not be sold or purchased, and such prices may be fixed generally in respect of all areas or persons or differentially in respect of particular areas or classes of persons.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No person shall buy or sell or offer to buy or sell jute or jute manufactures at any price below the minimum or above the maximum fixed under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fixation of baling charges, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ 8A. The Government may, by notified order, fix the maximum rates of charges for baling or storing, or of the commission of the brokers; and different rates may be fixed for different areas or for different classes of dealers.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Agents and brokers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Government may appoint agents and brokers on such terms, if any, as it may think fit, to purchase, store or sell jute on behalf of the Government and may prescribe the powers and responsibilities of such agents and brokers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Requisition of presses, godowns, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Government, may, by order in writing, requisition any kutcha or pucca press, any godown or any place, open or enclosed, and use the same, or allot it to any person for baling, selling or storing jute or for any other purpose incidental to the administration of this Ordinance whether such jute has been purchased by or on behalf of the Government or not.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any such press, godown or place is requisitioned under this section, there shall be paid compensation which shall be determined either with the agreement of the parties concerned or by an arbitrator chosen with their consent, and in the absence of such consent, by an arbitrator to be appointed in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration Act, 1940.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In determining the compensation under sub-section (2) the arbitrator shall have regard to the provisions of 18[ sub-section (1) of section 8 of the Acquisition and Requisition of Immovable Property Ordinance, 1982 (II of 1982)] so far as the same can be made applicable to acquisition of a temporary nature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Levy of jute cess</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Government may, by notified order, levy and collect, for the purpose of this Ordinance, a cess on all or any grades of jute produced in Bangladesh, at such rate or rates as may be specified in the order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the cess shall not be levied on, or collected from, growers of jute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The proceeds of the cess, after deducting the cost of collection, if any, shall be credited to a special fund to be called the Price Stabilisation Fund and shall be applied for meeting the expenses of any support schemes or buffer stock operations undertaken by the Government for the stabilisation of the prices of raw jute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Registration of contracts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may, by general or special order in writing, require any contract or class of contracts to be registered with such organisation and in such manner as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to prohibit sale, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct any exporter, manufacturer or 19[ trader] or class of exporters, manufacturers or 20[ traders] not to transport, store, buy, sell, use or otherwise dispose of any jute or jute manufactures or jute or jute manufactures of any specified description except in accordance with such conditions as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to direct sale, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21[ 13A. (1) The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct any manufacturer or 22[ trader] or class of manufacturers or 23[ traders], holding stock of jute or jute manufactures, to sell the whole or specified part of his stock to such person or persons as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may also fix the price at which any stock shall be sold in pursuance of any direction under sub-section (1):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such price shall be fixed unless an opportunity has been given to the buyer and seller to agree on a price between themselves within a specified period and they have failed to do so.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct any manufacturer or 24[ trader], or class of manufacturers or 25[ traders], to purchase, during such period or periods and from such area or areas, such quantity of jute, and to hold such minimum stock, as may be specified in the order.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to call for information, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Government may, at any time, by notified order, direct such person or class of persons as may be specified in the order to maintain such accounts and furnish such returns or other information relating to their production, stocks, sale, purchase or brokery of jute or jute manufactures to the Government or to such officer or authority subordinate to the Government 26[ * * *], within such period, and giving such particulars, as may be specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by order in writing, require any person to furnish or submit to it or to such person as may be specified in the order, any information, book or document which in the opinion of the Government should be obtained, inspected or examined for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may, at any time, by order in writing, direct such person or class of persons as may be specified in the order to furnish in such manner and to such person, such particulars relating to the fulfilment of any contract as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, at any time, by order in writing, authorise an officer of the Government 27[ * * *] or any other person to enter and inspect any premises in which he has reason to believe that the purchase, sale or storage for sale or baling of jute is taking place and to call for any document in connection therewith, and to collect such information as is referred to in sub-sections (1), (2) and (3).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to seize books of accounts, stocks, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28[ 14A. Any person, authorised in this behalf in writing by the Government, may, if he has reason to believe that a contravention of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder has been committed,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        seize, with previous sanction in writing of such authority as may be prescribed, licences, vouchers, books of accounts, stocks of jute or jute manufacture, weighment scales, weights and allied equipments in respect of which such contravention is believed to have been committed; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        require any person reasonably suspected to being concerned in such contravention to cause his stocks of jute and jute goods or any part thereof to be weighed and, if so directed, to be shifted to such place or places as may be specified.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers to secure fulfilment of contract</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. If in the opinion of the Government it is expedient or necessary so to do for the purpose of securing fulfilment of any contract on which a default has taken place, it may appropriate to the contract any jute or jute manufactures belonging to the defaulter, or it may buy jute or jute manufactures elsewhere and so appropriate it, and in either or both of such cases the defaulter shall be liable for any loss which the Government may sustain on account of the default, but shall not be entitled to any gain on the purchase made against such default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29[ 16. The Government may, by notified order, direct that any power conferred upon it by or under this Ordinance, shall in relation to such matters and subject to such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by such corporation, authority, agency or officer as may be so specified.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) Any person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Ordinance or any rule, order or direction issued thereunder shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any Court trying an offence under this Ordinance may direct that the whole or a part of the jute or jute manufactures in respect of which the Court is satisfied that the offence has been committed shall be forfeited to Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any person as aforesaid is a company or a body corporate, every director, manager, secretary or other officer, and every agent and servant thereof, and in the case of an unlimited company or a company limited by guarantees or a proprietary or partnership firm, also every member, proprietor or partner, as the case may be, shall, unless he proves that the contravention took place without his knowledge or that he exercised due diligence to prevent such contravention, be punishable as if he had contravened the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">False statements</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. If any person-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         when required by any order made under this Ordinance to make any statement or furnish any information, makes any statement or furnishes any information which is false in any material particular and which he knows or has reasonable cause to believe to be false, or does not believe to be true, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        makes any such statement as aforesaid in any book, account, record, declaration, return or other document which he is required by any such order to maintain or furnish, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       maintains a double set of books, accounts or any other records, in which the entries are not identical,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government 30[ * * *] or any official, authority or person acting on behalf of the Government 31[ * * *] in respect of anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance or any rule made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may prescribe the form of application and the amount of fee for the grant or renewal of a licence under section 6, the authority which may grant or renew such licences, the form of the licences and the conditions subject to which they may be granted, the authority to which an appeal may be made under section 7, the manner of presentation of appeal to such authority and the amount of fee to be paid for such appeal, and the powers and responsibilities of the agents appointed under section 9.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Except in so far as they are repugnant to or inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance, the East Bengal Jute Dealers Registration Rules, 1950, made under the East Bengal Jute Dealers Registration Act, 1949, shall be deemed to have been made under this Ordinance, and shall have effect accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to exempt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32[ 20A. The Government may, by order in writing, exempt, to such extent and subject to such conditions as may be specified therein, any person or class of persons or any kind or kinds of jute or jute manufactures, from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance or of any rule or order made thereunder.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) No Court shall take cognizance of any offence punishable under this Ordinance except on a report in writing of the facts constituting such offence made by 33[ * * *] a person acting on behalf of the Government 34[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35[ (2) The person acting on behalf of the Government may, instead of making a report of an offence under sub-section (1), compound such offence for such sum of money as may be determined by the person.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Special provision regarding fines</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Notwithstanding anything contained in section 32 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, it shall be lawful for any Magistrate of the first class specially empowered by the Provincial Government in this behalf to pass a sentence of fine exceeding one thousand rupees on any person convicted under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Presumption as to orders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. Where an order purports to have been made and signed by an authority in exercise of any power conferred by or under this Ordinance, a Court shall, within the meaning of the Evidence Act, 1872, presume that such order was so made by that authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of orders inconsistent with other enactments</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Any order made under this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any enactment other than this Ordinance or any instrument having effect by virtue of any enactment other than this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. [Repeals and saving.- Omitted by section 11 of the Jute (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XVI of 1983).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the word “Pakistan”, and the word “Central” was omitted by section 2 of the Jute (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XVI of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “and jute manufactures” were inserted by section 2 of the Jute (Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XLIX of 1974).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words and comma “traders in jute, jute manufactures and owners of” were substituted for the words “dealers in jute and occupiers of jute godowns and” by section 3 of the Jute (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XVI of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (a) was omitted by section 3 of the Jute (Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XLIX of 1974)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clause (c) was substituted by section 4 of the Jute (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XVI of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p (Ordinance No. XVI of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 The words “business in jute and jute manufacture” were substituted for the words “business in 318	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE KHULNA DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY ORDINANCE, 1961 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>KHULNA</strong><strong> DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY ORDINANCE, 1961 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE NO. II OF 1961).[21st January, 1961]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 An Ordinance to provide for the development, improvement and expansion of the 2[ city] of Khulna and certain areas in its vicinity and the constitution of an Authority therefore.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the development, improvement and expansion of the 3[ city] of Khulna and certain areas in its vicinity by opening up congested areas, laying out or altering streets, providing open spaces for purposes of ventilation or recreation, demolishing or constructing buildings, acquiring land for the said purposes and for the rehousing of persons displaced by the execution of improvement schemes, and otherwise as hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS it is expedient that an Authority should be constituted and invested with special powers for carrying out the objects aforesaid;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Presidential Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and having received the previous instructions of the President, the Governor is pleased, in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, to make and promulgate the following Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>CHAPTER I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Khulna Development Authority Ordinance, 1961.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the areas comprised within the limits of the 4[ Khulna City Corporation]; but the Government may, by notification, extend the Ordinance or any provision thereof to such other areas in the vicinity of the said 5[ Corporation] as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force in such areas and on such dates as the Government may, by notification, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Authority” means the Authority established under sub-section (1) of section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Authority appointed under sub-section (1) of section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Controlled area” means an area declared to be controlled area under section 26;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (c1) “Corporation” means the Khulna City Corporation;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Land” includes benefits to arise out of land and things attached to the earth or permanently fastened to anything attached to the earth;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Member” means a member of the Authority appointed under sub-section (1) of section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Notification” means notification published in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “Secretary to the Authority” means the person for the time being appointed by the Authority to discharge the functions of Secretary to the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (j) “Union Parishad” means a Union Prishad constituted under the Local Government (Union Parishads) Ordinance, 1983 (Ord. No. LI of 1983) and situated in any part of the Khulna District in which this Ordinance is in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “Zilla Parishad” means the Khulna Zilla Parishad.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CONSTITUTION OF THE AUTHORITY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may, by notification, establish an Authority to be known as the Khulna Development Authority for carrying out the purpose of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority shall be a body corporate, shall be entitled to acquire and hold property, shall have perpetual succession and common seal, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chairman, Members, Terms</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Authority shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Chairman to be appointed by the Government; Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Deputy Commissioner, Khulna, ex-officio; Member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (c)     the Mayor of the Corporation, ex-officio;] Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        a representative of the 10[ Bangladesh] Railway to be nominated by the Government, ex-officio; Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        a representative of the Khulna Port Trust to be nominated by the Port Trust; Member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         Superintending Engineer, Public Health Engineering, ex-officio; Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        a representative of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry to be appointed by Government from among a panel of three names to be nominated by the Khulna Chambers of Commerce; Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (h)  two Commissioners of the Corporation to be elected by Commissioners of the Corporation;] Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         not more than four Members to be appointed by the Government: Do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if at any time 12[ the Corporation is superseded under section 145 of the Khulna City Corporation Ordinance, 1984 (Ord. No. LXXII of 1984)], the seats allotted to it under clauses (c) and (h) of this sub-section shall be deemed to have fallen vacant, and such vacancies shall be filled by the Government by appointment, by notification, and the persons so appointed shall hold office until the re-constitution of the 13[ Corporation] under the provisions of the said Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that at least two of the persons so appointed shall be tax-payers of the 14[ Corporation].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The term of office of the Chairman shall be not more than five years and that of a Member except ex-officio Members three years, at a time:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may by notification in the official Gazette remove the Chairman or a Member at any time during the term of his Office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2A) [Omitted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973) which was inserted by section 2 of the Khulna Development Authority (Amendment) Act, 1964 (East Pakistan Act No. VIII of 1964).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any person ceasing to be the Chairman or Member by reason of the expiry of the term of his office may be reappointed for another term or for such shorter period as the Government may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman may be either a whole-time or a part-time officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Remuneration and condition of service of Chairman and Members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Chairman shall receive such monthly salary and allowances as may be fixed by the Government and be subject to such conditions of service as may be prescribed and shall perform such duties as are assigned to him under this Ordinance or rules made under it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Member shall be entitled to receive such fee or allowance for attending the meetings of the Authority, as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Resignation of Chairman, or Members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Chairman or any Member may at any time resign, provided that his resignation shall not take effect until accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of Chairman or Member</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A person shall be disqualified for being appointed Chairman or Member of the Authority; if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) has been declared insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        has been declared to be disqualified for employment in, or has been dismissed from the service of 15[ Bangladesh], or has been convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        has knowingly acquired or continued to hold, without the permission in writing of the Government, directly or indirectly or through a partner any share or interest in any contract or employment with or by or on behalf of the Authority, or in any land or property which, in his knowledge, is likely to benefit him or has benefited him as a result of the operation of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No person shall be disqualified as aforesaid, or be deemed to have any share or interest in such contract or employment as aforesaid, by reason only of having a share or interest in-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         any sale, purchase, lease, or exchange of land or any agreement for the same; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        any agreement for the loan of money, or any security for the payment of money only; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       any newspapers in which any advertisement relating to the affairs of the Authority is inserted; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       the occasional sale to the Authority, to a value not exceeding two thousand taka in any one financial year, of any article in which he trades;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">or by reason only of his having a share or interest, otherwise han as director, secretary, manager or other salaried officer, in any incorporated company which has any share or interest in any contract or employment with, by, or on behalf of, the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Filling of casual vacancies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. If the Chairman or any Member is granted leave or any one of them dies, resigns, or is removed from office, the Government may appoint a Chairman, or Member, as the case may be, for the period of absence or remainder of the term, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Conduct of Business</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Authority shall meet at such time and place and in such manner, as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until rules are made in this behalf such meetings shall be convened by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman, or in his absence, a Member authorised by the Chairman, and two other Members shall be present to constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Temporary Association of Members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Authority may associate with itself any person whose assistance or advice it may desire in carrying out any of the provisions of the Ordinance or rules thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person associated with itself by the Authority for any purpose shall have a right to take part in the discussions of the Authority but shall exercise no vote. An associate Member may be given such fee or allowance, as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No act done or proceeding taken under this Ordinance shall be questioned on the ground merely of -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the establishment of the Authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any omission, defect or irregularity not affecting the merits of the case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make and perform contracts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Authority may enter into and perform all such contracts as they may consider necessary or expedient for carrying out any of the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Making of contracts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 13. (1) Every such contract shall be made by the Chairman on behalf of the Authority:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a contract involving expenditure exceeding Taka five lakhs shall not be made by the Chairman without the previous sanction of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every estimate for expenditure of a sum for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance, all specifications of work and of the material or goods to be supplied and the conditions of the contract shall be approved,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        where the expenditure involved does not exceed Taka five lakhs, by the Chairman; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in other cases, by the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Sub sections (1) and (2) shall apply to every variation or abandonment of a contract or estimate as well as to an original contract or estimate.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Further provisions as to execution of contracts, and provisions as to seal of authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Every contract made by the Chairman on behalf of the Authority shall be entered into in such manner and forms as would bind the Chairman if such contract were made on his own behalf, except that the common seal of the Authority shall be used; and every such contract may in the like manner and form be varied or discharged.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every contract for the execution of any work or the supply of any materials or goods shall be in writing and shall be sealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The common seal of the Authority shall remain in the custody of the Secretary to the Authority and shall not be affixed to any contract or other instrument except in the presence of a Member (other than the Chairman), who shall attach his signature to the contract or instrument in token that the same was sealed in his presence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The signature of the said Member shall be in addition to the signature of any witness to the execution of such contract or instrument.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A contract not executed as provided in this section shall not be binding on the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tenders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ 15. (1) No contract shall be made for execution of any work or for supply of any material or goods without inviting tenders in respect thereof by notice published in local newspapers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The time to be stipulated in the notice for submission of a tender under sub-section (1) shall be,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in a case where the work to be executed or the material or goods to be supplied involves an expenditure not exceeding Taka ten thousand, not less than seven days; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in all other cases, fourteen days.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A tender submitted under sub-section (1) may be accepted by the Chairman but, in a case where the expenditure involved in the work to be executed or the material or goods to be supplied exceeds Taka five lakhs, the tender shall not be accepted by him without the prior approval of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The provisions of this section shall not be construed as requiring the acceptance by the Chairman or approval by the Authority of a tender; and the Chairman, where necessary with the approval of the Authority, may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) accept any tender which appears to him, in consideration of all circumstances, to be the most advantageous, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        reject all the tenders submitted to him.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Security for performance of contract</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Chairman shall take sufficient security for the due performance of every contract involving an expenditure exceeding one thousand taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Supply of documents and information to the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Chairman shall forward to the Government a copy of the minutes of the proceedings of each meeting of the Authority, within ten days from the date on which the minutes of the proceedings of such meeting were signed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Government so directs in any case, the Chairman shall forward to it a copy of all papers which were laid before the Authority for consideration at any meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may require the Chairman to furnish it with-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Authority, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a report on any such matter, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a copy of any document in the charge of the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government at any time, cause an investigation to be made by an officer appointed in this behalf into the affairs of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER III</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ESTABLISHMENT</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ 18. Subject to such rules as may be made by the Government in this behalf, the Authority may create such posts and appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be determined by regulations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no post the maximum pay of which, excluding technical pay, if any, is above Taka 1,250 per month shall be created or filled up by the Authority except with the prior approval of the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the creation of any post shall be subject to specific provision being made in the approved budget in that behalf.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. [Appointment, punishment and appeal.- Omitted by section 5 of the Khulna Development Authority (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LXVIII of 1976).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers to Chairman, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Authority may, by general or special order, delegate to Chairman, a Member or an Officer of the Authority, any of its powers, duties or functions under this Ordinance subject to such conditions as it may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Immunity of the authority and its employees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Chairman, Members, Officers and other employees of the Authority shall, when acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Ordinance, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the 19[ * * *] Penal Code, 1860.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Authority, the Chairman, Members or Officers and other employees of the Authority in respect of anything done or intended to be done, in good faith, under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER IV</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">POWERS AND DUTIES OF THE AUTHORITY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of Master Plan by the Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) The Authority shall, as soon as feasible, but not more than two years after the provisions of this Ordinance comes into force, prepare and submit to the Government for approval a Master Plan for the 20[ Corporation] and the areas in its vicinity indicating the manner in which it proposes that land should be used (whether by carrying out thereon of development or otherwise) and the stages by which any such development should be carried out.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Master Plan shall include such maps and such descriptive matter as may be necessary to illustrate the proposals aforesaid with such degree of particularity as may be appropriate between different parts of the 21[ city], and any such plan may, in particular, define the sites of proposed roads, public and other buildings and works, or fields, parks, pleasure-grounds and other open spaces or allocate areas of land for use for agricultural, residential, industrial or other purposes of any class specified in the Master Plan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government shall, within one month from the date of receipt of the Master Plan from the Authority, publish the same in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any person objecting to the Plan or part thereof shall file objection with the Government within thirty days from the date of the publication of the Master Plan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government after considering the objections that may be filed, shall approve the Master Plan within three months from the date of publication under sub section (3), either with or without modification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Publication of Master Plan</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) When the Government approves the Master Plan submitted under section 22 it shall announce the fact by notification and the publication of such noti¬fication shall be conclusive evidence that the Master Plan has been duly made and approved, and thereafter it shall be unlawful for any person to use any land for any purpose other than that laid down in the Master Plan, unless he has been permitted to do so under section 24.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authority may, from time to time, with the approval of the Government, and the Government may, at any time, amend or alter any specific provision of the Master Plan. Any such amendment or alteration shall be published in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All future developments and construction, both public and private, shall be in conformity with the Master Plan or with the amendment thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Master Plan, or an amendment thereof, shall neither before nor after it has been approved, be questioned in any legal proceedings whatsoever and shall become operative on the day it is published in the official Gazette under sub section (1) or sub section (2), as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Permission for use of land contrary to the Master Plan</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) If any person desires to use any land for any purpose other than that laid down in the Master Plan approved under section 23, he may apply in writing to the Chairman for permission so to do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Chairman refuses permission to any person, such person may, within sixty days of the Chairman's refusal, appeal to the Authority against such refusal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The decision of the Authority on any appeal under sub-section (2) shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No compensation shall be payable to any person owing to the restricted use to which his land may be put under section 23.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authorised Officer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. After publication of the Master Plan, the Chairman or any Officer of the Authority, from such date as the Government may, by notification, declare, shall be deemed to be the only authorised officer, within the meaning of clause (a) of section 2 of the 22[ * * *] Building Construction Act, 1952, which Act shall be deemed to be modified to that extent, so far as it relates to the area within the jurisdiction of the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Controlled Area</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Authority may, by notification, declare any area included in the Master Plan to be a controlled area for the purpose of this Ordinance, and may issue in respect of such area such directions as it considers fit and appropriate, and may do all things as may be necessary for the prevention or correction of substandard or haphazard growth of colonies, and buildings and operations in such area.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Declaration of use area and location thereof</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The Authority may, after giving due notice in writing to the persons affected thereby and after giving such persons an opportunity of being heard, declare any area included in the Master Plan to be a use area.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If within two years after such declaration has been made the area or any part thereof remains, in the opinion of the Authority, unreasonably unutilised, then upon such determination such area or part thereof shall be valued by the Authority and, after such valuation, shall be taxed by the Authority annually at the rate of three per cent of the value thereof until such time as an improvement satisfactory to the Authority shall have been completed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The tax revenues accruing under this section shall belong to, and may be utilised for the general purposes of, the Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Outline Programme and Improvement Schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of Development Programmes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) After publication of the Master Plan under sub section (3) of section 22, the Authority shall prepare, and submit to the Government Five Year Programmes of development and improvement of the areas covered by the Master Plan, on the basis of the said Plan, listing the schemes of development and improvement, including works of water supply and sewerage in their approximate order of execution and with approximate cost of each.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall, within six months of its submission, either approve or disapprove the Programme referred to in sub section (1), or approve it with such additions or modifications as, in consultation with the Authority, it deems fit to make.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation and submission of specific schemes to Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) After approval of the Programmes by the Government, with or without any modification, the Authority shall prepare and submit to the Government specific schemes on the basis of the Programme, including any other scheme or schemes which the Government may direct the Authority to prepare, and all such schemes shall contain plans for the proposed development, including those for housing, if any, with estimates of cost and proposed methods of financing. Any such scheme involving ejectment of persons should also indicate the manner of resettlement or re housing of affected persons:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Authority may, without need for further approval by the Government, under intimation to the Government, undertake execution of any scheme already approved by it in the Programmes, the total estimated cost of which does not exceed taka one lakh and specific provision for which exists in the annual estimate for income and expenditure of the Authority:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the Authority may, with the prior approval of the Government, take up for execution schemes of urgent public importance even before the preparation of the Master Plan under section 22 and of the development programme based thereon under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may sanction, with or without any modification, or may refuse to sanction, or may return for reconsideration, any specific scheme submitted to it under sub-section (1), or may call for such further details or information about the scheme, or may direct such further examination of the scheme, as it may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A scheme framed and sanctioned under this Ordinance may be amended or modified by the Authority at any time but if a material change is made in the scheme, previous sanction of the Government shall be obtained.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- An increase in the cost of the scheme by more than ten per cent of the sanctioned cost shall be deemed to be a material change for the purpose of this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Matters to be provided for improvement scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30.
