justify;">(i)         any other act which may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No act specified in sub-section (1) shall be deemed to be a notarial act except when it is done by a notary under his signature and official seal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar of practice without certificate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Subject to the provisions of this section, no person shall practise as a notary or do any notarial act under the official seal of a notary unless he holds a certificate of practice in force issued to him under section 5:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this sub-section shall apply to the presentation of any promissory note, hundi or bill of exchange for acceptance or payment by the clerk of a notary acting on behalf of such notary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) [Omitted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of names from Register</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government may, by order, remove from the Register maintained by it under section 4 the name of the notary if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        makes a request to that effect; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        has not paid any prescribed fee required to be paid by him; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        has been found, upon inquiry in the prescribed manner, to be guilty of such professional or other misconduct as, in the opinion of the Government, renders him unfit to practise as a notary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Construction of references to notaries public in other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Subject to the provisions of section 16, any reference to a notary public in any other law shall be construed as a reference to a notary entitled to practise under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for falsely representing to be a notary, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Any person who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        falsely represents that he is a notary without being appointed as such, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        practises as a notary or does any notarial act in contravention of section 9,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) No Court shall take cognizance of any offence committed by a notary in the exercise or purported exercise of his functions under this Ordinance save upon complaint in writing made by an officer authorised by the Government by general or special order in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No magistrate other than a magistrate of the first class shall try an offence punishable under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reciprocal arrangements for recognition of notarial acts done by foreign notaries</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. If the Government is satisfied that by the law or practice of any country or place outside Bangladesh, the notarial acts done by notaries within Bangladesh are recognised for all or any limited purposes in that country or place, the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that the notarial acts lawfully done by notaries within such country or place shall be recognised within Bangladesh for all purposes or, as the case may be, for such limited purposes as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the qualifications of a notary, the form and manner in which applications for appointment as a notary may be made and the disposal of such applicants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the certificates, testimonials or proofs as to character, integrity, ability and competence which any person applying for appointment as a notary may be required to furnish;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the fees payable for appointment as a notary and for the issue and renewal of a certificate of practice, and exemption, whether wholly or in part, from such fees in specified classes of cases;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the fees payable to a notary for doing any notarial act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the form of Registers and the particulars to be entered therein;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the form and design of the seal of a notary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the manner in which inquiries into allegations or professional or other misconduct of notaries may be made;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the acts which a notary may do in addition to those specified in section 8 and the manner in which a notary may perform his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Saving of Act XXVI of 1881</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Nothing in this Ordinance affects the provisions of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, or any appointment made in pursuance of section 138 of that Act or the powers of any person so appointed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted for the words “Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” or “Central Government” respectively by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “or any advocate of the High Court” were omitted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “in the territory now comprised in Bangladesh” were substituted for the word “Pakistan” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the words “the Province” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “the” was susbtituted for the word “that” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “the” was susbtituted for the word “that” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word “the” was susbtituted for the word “that” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
325	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PETROLEUM PRODUCTS (DEVELOPMENT SURCHARGE) ORDINANCE,1961</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE PETROLEUM PRODUCTS (DEVELOPMENT SURCHARGE) ORDINANCE, 1961</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXV OF 1961) [1st July, 1961]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the levy and collection of a development surcharge on petroleum products and for matters connected therewith.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the levy and collection of a development surcharge on petroleum products and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, therefore, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>extent and commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Petroleum Products (Development Surcharge) Ordinance 1961.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the first day of August 1959.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) “Company” means a company specified in the Second Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) “Development surcharge” means the surcharge payable under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) “Differential margin” means the amount by which the fixed sale price exceeds the prescribed price;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) “ Fixed sale price” means the ex-Installation sale price as in force on the thirty-first day of July, 1959, or the price, if any, approved by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) “Petroleum Product” means any petroleum product specified in the First Schedule; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) “Prescribed price” means the ex-Installation price as determined in accordance with the rules made under section 6.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Levy of Development Surcharge</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. 2[ (1)] Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, every company shall pay to the Government a development surcharge equal to the differential margin in respect of the quantities of petroleum products sold by the company through an installation except for export:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the prescribed price of any petroleum product exceeds its fixed sale price, the Government may, by order in writing, permit the company to deduct the amount of such excess from the differential margin in respect of the other petroleum products.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) [Omitted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No.VIII of 1973).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any amount due as development surcharge under sub-section (1) 3[ * * *] and not paid within the time allowed by the Government or any officer authorised by it in that behalf shall be recoverable as arrears of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Maximum sale price</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, no company shall sell ex-Installation any petroleum product at a price higher than the fixed sale price.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A contravention of sub-section (1) shall be deemed to be a contravention of an order made under section 3 of the 4[ Essential Commodities Act, 1957 (III of 1957)], and all the provisions of that Act shall have effect accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Nothing in this Ordinance shall be deemed to have or ever to have had the effect of retrospectively creating any offence or of retrospectively enhancing the punishment for any offence provided in any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Allowance to be made for development surcharge for purposes of income-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, the amount of the development surcharge paid by a company under section 3 shall be an expenditure for which allowance is to be made in computing profits or gains under 5[ Chapter V and Chapter VI of the Income-tax Ordinance, 1984 (Ord. No. XXXVI of 1984)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance and any such rules may be retrospective from any date not earlier then the first day of August, 1959.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the determination of the prescribed price;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for any other matter for which there is no provision or no sufficient provision in this Ordinance and for which provision is, in the opinion of the Government, necessary in order to give effect to the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to amend Schedules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, make such amendments and modifications in the Schedules as it thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted respectively for the word “Pakistan” and “Central Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The bracket and figure “(1)” was inserted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words, brackets and figure “or arrears thereof under sub-section (2)” were omitted by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words, comma, figures and brackets “Essential Commodities Act, 1957 (III of 1957)” were substituted for the words, comma, figures and brackets “Essential Supplies Act, 1957 (III of 1957)” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words, figures, comma and brackets “Chapter V and Chapter VI of the Income-tax Ordinance, 1984 (Ord. No. XXXVI of 1984)” were substituted for the words, brackets, figures, and comma “sub-section (2) of section 10 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922)” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
326	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PORT AUTHORITIES LANDS AND BUILDINGS (RECOVERY OF POSSESSION) ORDINANCE, 1962 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>PORT</strong><strong> </strong><strong>AUTHORITIES</strong><strong> </strong><strong>LANDS</strong><strong> AND BUILDINGS (RECOVERY OF POSSESSION) ORDINANCE, 1962 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. IX OF 1962).[17th February, 1962]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An  Ordinance to provide for the speedy recovery of possession of certain lands and buildings. 1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the speedy recovery of possession from unauthorised occupants of lands or buildings belonging to Port Authorities within the limits of major ports, and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, application and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Port  Authorities Lands and Buildings (Recovery of Possession) Ordinance, 1962.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It applies to all major ports.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “allotment” means permission to occupy temporarily any premises either free of rent or on an agreed rental, without conferring any right or interest in respect thereof on the person to whom such permission has been granted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Authorised Officer” means a Magistrate of the First Class appointed by the Government, by notification in the official Gazette, to exercise all or any of the powers of an Authorised Officer under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “land or building” means land or building, or part thereof, which vests in, or is in the possession or under the management or control of a Port Authority, and is used or held for purposes connected with the administration and working of the port;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “lease” has the same meaning as in the Transfer of Property Act, 1882, and includes an allotment; and “lessee”, which includes his heirs, assigns, legal representatives and all persons inducted by him into the demised land, shall be construed accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “major port” means a port to which the Ports Act, 1908, for the time being extends;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “port authority” means an authority vested by or under any law for the time being in force with the administration of a major port;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “unauthorised occupant” means a person who is in occupation of any land or building without the permission of the Port Authority, and includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) a person inducted into any land or building by the original lessee of such land or building; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        a person who remains in occupation of any land or building after the determination of the lease in respect of such land or building.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Eviction of out-going lessees and unauthorised occupants from land</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) If, on the expiry, whether before or after the commencement of this Ordinance, of the period of any lease in respect of any land or building of which a Port Authority is the lessor, or on the determination of such lease on the ground of breach of any covenant or in pursuance of a condition in the lease imposing any obligation on the lessee to give up possession of the demised land or building in the event of such land or building being required for the purposes of a Port Authority, the lessee refused or failed, or refuses or fails, to vacate and deliver vacant possession of such land or building to the Port Authority, then, notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract, such Port Authority may, by notice in writing, require such lessee to vacate and deliver vacant possession of such land or building, and to remove structures, if any, erected or built thereon by him, within such time as may be specified in the notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Port Authority is satisfied, after making such enquiry as it may think fit, that a person is an unauthorised occupant of any land or building, it may, by notice in writing, require such person to vacate such land or building, and deliver vacant possession thereof to it, and to remove structures, if any, erected or built thereon by him, within such time as may be specified in the notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If any person to whom a notice is issued under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        fails to comply with the notice, the Port Authority shall make a complaint in writing to that effect to the Authorised Officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        vacates the land or building, but does not remove the structures thereon, the Port Authority may take possession of such land or building and demolish such structures.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Proceedings before Authorised Officer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Upon receipt of complaint under section 3, the Authorised Officer shall forthwith issue notice to the person against whom the complaint has been made calling upon him to show cause why he should not be evicted from the land or building occupied by him, and after giving such person an opportunity of being heard, and if necessary, after making such further enquiry as he may think fit, the Authorised Officer, shall, by an order in writing, either-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) permit such person to continue in occupation of the land or building, subject to such conditions as may be specified in the order; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        direct such person to vacate and deliver to the Port Authority vacant possession of the land or building, and to remove structures, if any, erected or built thereon by him, within the period specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any person fails to comply with a direction under clause (b) of sub-section (1), the Authorised Officer may, notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, but subject to any order on appeal under section 5, enter upon the land or building to which the direction relates, and evict such person by such force as he may consider necessary, and demolish any or all of the said structures.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No person shall be evicted under sub-section (2) between sunset and sunrise.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order under sub-section (1) of section 4 may, within fifteen days from the date of such order, appeal, in such manner and on payment of such fee as may be prescribed, to the District Magistrate, or an Additional District Magistrate who may, pending the disposal of such appeal, make such orders as he thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The decision of the District Magistrate or an Additional District Magistrate on an appeal under sub-section (1) shall be final and shall not be called in question in any Court or by any authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Service of notice and order</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. A notice or an order under section 3 or section 4 shall be served in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of cost of demolition of structures</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The cost of demolition of structures under section 3 or section 4, hereafter in this section referred to as the cost, shall be payable to the Port Authority by the lessee or unauthorised occupant evicted .</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the cost is not paid on demand, the Authorised Officer may, on an application made in this behalf by the Port Authority, and after giving the lessee or the unauthorised occupant an opportunity of being heard, cause the materials of the structures demolished to be sold in auction in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the proceeds of the sale under sub-section (2) are not sufficient to cover the cost, the balance shall be recoverable as arrears of land revenue and, if such proceeds exceed the cost, the excess shall be paid to the lessee or the unauthorised occupant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of arrears of rent</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. If any rent payable in respect of any land or building has been in arrears on the day of recovery of possession of such land or building, the amount due on account of such arrears, with interest, if any, accrued thereon, shall be recoverable as arrears of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction of Courts barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Save as provided by this Ordinance no Court shall question anything done under this Ordinance by or at the instance of a Port Authority, or to grant an injunction, or to make any other order, in relation to any notice or complaint issued or made by a Port Authority under this Ordinance, or in relation to any proceedings before an Authorised Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against a Port Authority or any person in respect of anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. A Port Authority may, with the previous approval in writing of the Government, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Government” was substituted for the words “Central Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
327	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PREVENTION OF INTERFERENCE WITH AIDS TO NAVIGATION ORDINANCE, 1962 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PREVENTION OF INTERFERENCE WITH AIDS TO NAVIGATION ORDINANCE, 1962 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE NO. II OF 1962).[19th January, 1962]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for punishment for interfering with the marks, buoys, lights, etc. installed on the inland waterways in Bangladesh.       1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for punishment of persons interfering with the aids to navigation installed on the inland waterways in Bangladesh for safe navigation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Presidential Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and having received the previous instructions of the President, the Governor is pleased, in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, to make and promulgate the following Ordinance, namely</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the 2[ * * *] Prevention of Interference with Aids to Navigation Ordinance, 1962.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “aids to navigation” means marks, buoys, lights, bandals and other contrivances installed for conservancy of channels and aids to navigation by the Authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Authority” means the Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Authority established under section 3 of the 3[ * * *] Inland Water Transport Authority Ordinance, 1958; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “mischief ” means mischief as defined in section 425 of the 4[ * * *] Penal Code, 1860.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty for intentionally causing damage and tampering with aids to navigation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Whoever commits mischief by damaging, removing, tampering with or handling any of the aids to navigation, or by doing any act which renders any of the aids to navigation less useful as such, and whoever abets such mischief, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Report to the District Magistrate regarding repeated damage, etc and imposition of collective fines</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Whenever it appears to the Authority that any act causing or likely to cause wrongful damage to, or any act of wrongful removal of, any of the aids to navigation is repeatedly committed in any place, the Authority, or an officer authorised by the Authority in this behalf, may make a report to the District Magistrate within whose jurisdiction the offence has been committed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On receipt of the report under sub section (1) the District Magistrate shall make, or cause to be made, such enquiries as he deems fit; and if the District Magistrate is satisfied as a result of such enquiry that the inhabitants of any local area are concerned in the repeated commission of any such acts or are in any way assisting persons in committing such acts, the District Magistrate may, by order in writing specifying the reasons for making such order, impose on the inhabitants of such area, a collective fine which may extend to one thousand 5[ taka] or three times the value of all the aids to navigation lost or damaged by such acts, whichever is greater, and may apportion such fine among such inhabitants in proportion to their respective means.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every order imposing a collective fine under sub-section (2) shall be forthwith published in the local area in such manner as the District Magistrate considers best calculated to bring the order to the notice of the inhabitants of the area concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The District Magistrate may exempt any person or class or section of such inhabitants from liability to pay any portion of such fine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The portion of such fine payable by any person may be recovered from him as a fine or as a public demand under the 6[ * * *] Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Every apportionment of collective fine made under sub section (2) shall be subject to revision by the Sessions Judge of the District on application made in that behalf to him by any persons affected by such apportionment within thirty days from the date on which such apportionment is made; and the decision of the Sessions Judge thereon shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The 7[ Government] may, by order in writing, define the limits of the area for purposes of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Payment of fine realised to Authority</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The District Magistrate may order that such fine or proportion thereof realised under section 3 or under section 4 be paid to the Authority, as he may deem fit under the circumstances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences under the Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, offences under this Ordinance shall, for the purposes of the said Code, be bailable and non cognizable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the words “East Pakistan” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “East Pakistan” were omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “East Pakistan” were omitted by section 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Pakistan” was omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “taka” was substituted for the word “rupees” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “Bengal” was omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word “Government” was substituted for the words “Provincial Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
328	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE PUBLICATION OF BOOKS (REGULATION AND CONTROL) ORDINANCE, 1965</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE PUBLICATION OF BOOKS (REGULATION AND CONTROL) ORDINANCE, 1965</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE NO. V OF 1965).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[26th October, 1965]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the regulation and control of printing and publication of books or works first published in a foreign country. 1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the regulation and control of printing and publication of books or works first published in a foreign country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the Provincial Assembly of East Pakistan is not in session and the Governor is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate legislation necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by Article 79 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, the Governor is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title, extent and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the 2[ * * *] Publication of Books (Regulation and Control) Ordinance, 1965.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “book” includes every volume, part or division of a volume, and pamphlet, in any language, and every sheet of music, map, chart or plan, separately printed or lithographed, but does not include a newspaper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “person” shall, include the proprietors, directors, managers, secretary or other officer or agent of a company or body corporate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “work” means a literary work.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All words used in this Ordinance, but not defined in this Ordinance, and used in the 3[ Printing Presses and Publications (Declaration and Registration) Act, 1973 (XXIII of 1973) and ??????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???) ], shall have the same meanings as in those Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Restriction on Publication of certain books or works</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) No person shall, except with the permission of the Government or such officer as may be specially empowered in this behalf, print or publish any book or work which is first printed or published in any foreign country.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person who has printed or published any book or work, which was first printed or published in any foreign country, immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance, shall, within two months from the date of commencement of this Ordinance, obtain permission of the Government under this Ordinance for publication or putting on circulation of such books or works.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application for permission</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) An application for permission to print or publish a book or work shall be made in such manner and form and on payment of such fee as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government or the officer specially empowered under sub-section (1) of section 3 shall refuse permission to print or publish a book or work if the book or work is prejudicial to the tradition, culture or national interest.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order under sub-section (2) of section 4 may, within one month from the date of such order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) prefer an appeal to the Government, if such order is passed by the officer specially empowered under sub-section (1) of section 3, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) apply for a review to the Government if such order is passed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any order passed in appeal or review under sub-section (1) shall be final and shall not be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any book or work from the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Any person contravening any provision of this Ordinance shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to one thousand 4[ Taka], or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Forfeiture of the book or work</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. On conviction, all copies of the book or work wherever found shall stand forfeited to Government and any Police-Officer may seize the same wherever found in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction to try offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) No Court shall take cognizance of an offence punishable under this Ordinance, except on complaint in writing made by the Government or by an officer authorised for the purpose by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the First Class shall try any offence under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An offence under this Ordinance shall be cognizable and non-bailable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar to jurisdiction of Civil Courts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, no civil Court shall entertain any application or suit for any action taken or anything done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted for the words “East Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “East Pakistan” were omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words, commas, figures and brackets “Printing Presses and Publications (Declaration and Registration) Act, 1973 (XXIII of 1973) and ??????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ???? ???) ” were substituted for the words, commas, figures and brackets “Press and Publications Ordinance, 1960 (Ordinance No. XV of 1960) and the Copyright Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XXIV of 1962)” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Taka” was substituted for the word “rupees” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
329	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE REGISTRATION OF PRIVATE SCHOOLS ORDINANCE, 1962 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE REGISTRATION OF PRIVATE SCHOOLS ORDINANCE, 1962 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE NO. XX OF 1962).[6th June, 1962]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the registration of private schools in Bangladesh.     1 2</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS, in order to supervise and regulate the working of private schools in Bangladesh, it is expedient to provide for registration of such schools;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Presidential Proclamation of the seventh day of October, 1958, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Governor is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the 3[ * * *] Registration of Private Schools Ordinance, 1962.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force on such date or dates and in such area or areas as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint and specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (a)     “Appellate Authority” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in respect of an order made by the Divisional Deputy Director, the Director General, Directorate of Primary Education;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in respect of an order made by the Regional Deputy Director, the Director General, Directorate of Secondary and Higher Education; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       in other cases, the Government;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “children” means boys and girls above the age of four and below the age of eighteen receiving instructions at any stage of education;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (bb) “higher secondary education” means education pertaining to classes XI and XII and includes courses equivalent to “A” level of any foreign educational institution;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Junior 6[ Secondary] School education” means education pertaining to Classes VI, VII and VIII and includes a course of study for Junior Cambridge Examination;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (d) “local council” means a Union Parishad, Upazila Parishad, Paurashava, Zila Parishad and a Municipal Corporation;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (dd) “nursery” means and includes Child-Care, Day-Care, Mother-Care or any other Centre, by whatever name called, imparting education to boys and girls not exceeding the age of 6 years;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “primary education” means education pertaining to Classes I, II, III, IV and V and includes all courses of study in the Nursery, Preparatory and Kindergarten  Schools;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (g)    “private school” means any 10[ institution including “O” and “A” level, Nursery, Junior Cambridge, Senior Cambridge, International Baccalaureate or equivalent institution established] and run by a person or body of persons, not being the Government or a local council for the purpose of imparting organised instruction to ten or more children at a time, but shall not include an institution which is recognised by the Government or a Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education or other prescribed authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Registering Authority” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in the case of private schools imparting secondary education 11[ and higher secondary education], the concerned Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education or other prescribed authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in the case of private schools imparting Junior Secondary School Education, the Directorate General, Directorate of Secondary and Higher Education, or the Regional Deputy Director, if so authorised by the Director General, Directorate of Secondary and Higher Education; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       in the case of private schools imparting primary education, the Director General, Director of Primary Education or the Divisional Deputy Director, if so authorised by the Director General, Directorate of Primary Education, and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “secondary education” means education pertaining to Classes IX and X and includes courses of study for Senior Cambridge and Cambridge School Certificate Examinations 12[ and includes “O” level of any foreign educational institution and equivalent thereof].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition against establishing or continuing a private school without registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. No private school shall be established or run except in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application for registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Any person intending to establish a private school and any person intending that a private school already in existence should be continued as such, shall make an application to the Registering Authority in the prescribed form accompanied by the prescribed registration fee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Registering Authority, on receipt of the application, shall make such enquiries as he considers necessary in order to satisfy himself-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) that the buildings and premises will provide adequate facilities with due regard to hygiene;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) that the staff will be qualified, adequate and adequately paid according to prescribed standards;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) that the fees charged will not be disproportionate to the facilities provided and will not exceed prescribed limits;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) that there is no reason to believe that the institution will be run in an undesirable manner or by undesirable persons;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) that the school follows a curriculum approved by 13[ the concerned Board] of Intermediate and Secondary Education or other prescribed authority; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) that no book which has not been approved by the 14[ National Curriculum and Text Book Board] or which has not been published and printed by it, is prescribed for study in the school.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ (3) If the Registering Authority, after enquiry within ninety days of the making of the application under sub-section (1), is satisfied in respect of the matters set out in sub-section (2), he shall proceed to give registration in the prescribed manner.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) [Omitted by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The person or persons to whom a certificate is granted shall be responsible for due compliance of the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder and the terms and conditions, if any, on which the certificate is granted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and continuance of private schools</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) A private school, not already in existence, shall be established only after a certificate has been granted under sub section (3) of section 4:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such school may be established and run after an application for registration under sub-section (1) of section 4 has been made till the disposal of such application, but shall be closed down immediately if the certificate under sub section (3) of that section is refused.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A private school already in existence in respect of which an application under sub section (1) of section 4 has been made within sixty days of the coming into force of this Ordinance may continue pending the disposal of the application, but shall close down immediately if the certificate under sub section (3) of that section is refused.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A private school, already in existence, in respect of which no application under sub section (1) of section 4 has been made within a period of sixty days next after the coming into force of this Ordinance, shall not continue after the expiry of that period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Suspension or cancellation of certificate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. A certificate issued under sub section (3) of sec¬tion 4 may be suspended or cancelled by the Registering Authority if there is a contravention of any of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder or any of the terms and conditions imposed under sub section (3) of section 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. If the Registering Authority refuses to grant a certificate under sub section (3) of section 4, or suspends or cancels under section 6, a certificate so granted, the applicant or the holder of the certificate may, within thirty days from the date of order of the Registering Authority, prefer an appeal to the Appellate Authority, and the Order passed by the Appellate Authority shall be final and given effect to by the Registering Authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to give effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Whoever wilfully contravenes any of the provi¬sions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder or the conditions imposed under sub section (3) of section 4 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which         may extend to one year, or fine which may extend to 16[ ten thousand] 17[ taka], or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except upon complaint in writing made by an Officer authorised by the Government in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to exempt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Government, if it thinks fit, may by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any class of private schools from the operation of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government, if it thinks fit may, on application, exempt any private school from the operation of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Bangladesh” was substituted for the words “East Pakistan” by Article 5 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Throughout this Ordinance, the word “Government” was substituted for the words “Provincial Government” by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “East Pakistan” were omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (a) was substituted by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 e word “Secondary” was substituted for the word “High” by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 ause (d) was substituted by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 ause (dd) was inserted by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clauses (g) and (h) were substituted by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 e words, letter and commas “institution including “O” and “A” level, Nursery, Junior Cambridge, Senior Cambridge, International Baccalaureate or equivalent institution established ” were substituted for the words “institution established” by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 e words “and higher secondary education” were inserted by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 e words “and includes “O” level of any foreign educational institution and equivalent thereof” were inserted by section 2 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The words “the concerned Board” were substituted for the words “the Board” by section 4 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 The words “National Curriculum and Text Book Board” were substituted for the words “East Pakistan School Text Book Board” by section 4 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 Sub-section (3) was substituted by section 3 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The words “ten thousand” were substituted for the words “one thousand” by section 4 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. III of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The word “taka” was substituted for the word “rupees” by section 5 of the Registration of Private Schools (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XVIII of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
330	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE RESERVISTS (REINSTATEMENT IN CIVIL EMPLOYMENT) ORDINANCE, 1965</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE RESERVISTS (REINSTATEMENT IN CIVIL EMPLOYMENT) ORDINANCE, 1965 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXI OF 1965).[21st July, 1965]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the reinstatement in civil employment of reservists called up for service or training in any of the Defence Services.          1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the reinstatement in civil employment of reservists called up for service or training in any of the Defence Services and matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the national interest of Pakistan in relation to the achievement of uniformity within the meaning of clause (2) of Article 131 of the Constitution requires Central legislation in the matter;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS the National Assembly is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate legislation necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 29 of the Constitution, and of all other powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.
